intro: Pedicularis kungeica, commonly known as the Kungei lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically red or purple in color, often with a distinctive spurred shape. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
